result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael Andrew Lind in court.  Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court for Michael Andrew Lind.  Attorney Grace M. Gall in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea hearing.  Matter called during the AM session, Defense requests an adjournment.  Court rescheduled matter for plea/sentencing hearing.  This matter will be held in person in Room 634 of the Courthouse.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 6, 2023 at 02:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9-30-22

HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/LIVE ON DACAST.

Defendant Michael Lind appears with Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense requests a plea date.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Received and Filed:  Pretrial Services Supervision Report 6-24-22

Defendant Michael Andrew Lind and Attorney Michael L. Chernin.  BOTH APPEARED BY VIDEO.  Samantha Raygo appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 8:30.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 4-12-22
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Violation Report 3-24-22
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Michael Andrew Lind in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
